title: OTC Hearing Aids, Done Right: Self‑Fit, Save, and Know When to Get Help
description: Over-the-counter hearing aids can be a smart, affordable way to hear better—if you choose the right pair and self-fit them carefully. Here’s how to know if you’re a good candidate, pick features that matter, dial in your sound at home, and recognize when to bring in an audiologist.

title: Listening Fatigue Is Real: Use Your Hearing Aids to Spend Less Energy on Every Conversation
description: Feeling drained after conversations? Learn why listening fatigue happens, how hearing aids can help (or hurt), and the practical settings, habits, and assistive tech that make speech easier and your energy last longer.

title: Sudden Hearing Loss Needs Speed: Treatments and the Critical Window
description: If one ear suddenly sounds muffled or “gone,” act fast. Learn what sudden sensorineural hearing loss is, why hours matter, and the treatments that can save hearing—including oral and intratympanic steroids, hyperbaric oxygen, and next steps if recovery stalls.

title: Music, Not Mush: Tuning Hearing Aids So Songs and Instruments Sound Right
description: If music sounds thin, harsh, or weird through your hearing aids, you’re not imagining it. Here’s how to tweak settings, choose accessories, and work with an audiologist so live music, streaming, and your own instrument feel alive again—without risking your hearing.

title: Long COVID and Your Hearing: What We Know (and What to Do Next)
description: Ringing, muffled hearing, or noise sensitivity after COVID? You’re not alone. Here’s the latest research on Long COVID and the ears, practical steps you can take now, and when to see an audiologist or ENT.

title: Your Hearing Aids, Verified: Real-Ear Measurements That Make Voices Clear
description: If speech still sounds muddy or too sharp—even with premium hearing aids—there’s a strong chance your devices aren’t matched to your ears. Real-ear measurements (REM), also called probe-microphone verification, align your hearing aids to evidence-based targets so conversation clicks into focus.

title: Hearing Supplements: Hype vs. Help (What Science Says)
description: Can vitamins or herbs fix hearing loss or tinnitus? A clear, science-based look at what might help, what probably won’t, and how to protect your hearing without wasting money.

title: Is Your Jaw Messing With Your Ears? TMJ, Ear Fullness, and That “Muffled” Feeling
description: Jaw clenching and TMJ disorders can trigger ear fullness, muffled hearing, and tinnitus—even when your ear exam is normal. Learn how the jaw–ear connection works, what’s a red flag, and the practical steps that actually help.

title: Earwax, Safely Solved: At‑Home Softeners, When to Flush, and When to See a Pro
description: A clear, evidence-based guide to safely removing earwax: which drops work, how to irrigate without hurting your ears, what to avoid, and when to call an audiologist or ENT.

title: Surfer’s Ear and Cold-Water Hearing Loss: Stop Bony Growths Before They Block Your Sound
description: Cold water and wind can trigger bony growths in your ear canal—called exostoses—that trap water, cause infections, and lead to conductive hearing loss. Learn the early signs, real-world prevention, safe drying, and when treatment (including surgery) makes sense.

title: Make Your Voice Sound Natural in Hearing Aids: Beat the Occlusion Effect
description: If your own voice sounds boomy, echoey, or "in a barrel" with hearing aids, you’re likely experiencing the occlusion effect. Here’s why it happens—and the exact fit, settings, and habits that make your voice feel like you again.

title: Pressure-Proof Your Ears: Prevent Barotrauma When You Fly, Drive High, or Dive
description: That stabbing ear pain on landing or the muffled, underwater feeling after a dive isn’t “just part of travel.” Here’s a practical, evidence-based plan to prevent ear barotrauma and protect your hearing anytime pressure changes.

title: Hearing at Work: Accommodations, Tech, and Tactics That Make Your Job Easier
description: Struggling to follow meetings, video calls, or open-office chatter? Here’s a practical, evidence-informed playbook for making your workplace more hearing-friendly—rights, tools, room fixes, and how to partner with an audiologist.

title: Hyperacusis Treatment: Rebuild Your Sound Tolerance Without Hiding
description: If everyday sounds feel painfully loud, you’re not alone. Learn evidence-based hyperacusis treatment: safe sound exposure, CBT skills, when to use hearing protection, and how audiologists can help you regain comfort and confidence in daily life.

title: Pregnancy and Your Hearing: The Surprising Ear Changes (and How to Handle Them)
description: Expecting and noticing ear fullness, ringing, or dizziness? Here’s why pregnancy can change how you hear, what’s typically normal, the red flags to know, and gentle, evidence-based ways to feel and hear better—plus when to see an audiologist or ENT.

title: AI in Hearing Aids: Myth, Reality, and How to Get Better Speech-in-Noise
description: Manufacturers promise “AI-powered” hearing aids that finally fix the cocktail party problem. Here’s what that tech actually does, where it shines and falls short, and the smart steps you can take with your audiologist to hear better in noise.

title: Otosclerosis Treatment: Stapedotomy or Hearing Aids—How to Choose
description: If you’ve been told you have otosclerosis, you likely face a clear but nuanced choice: live well with hearing aids or consider a tiny middle-ear surgery called a stapedotomy. This guide explains both paths—what they do, who benefits most, recovery, risks, costs, and how to make a confident, informed decision with your audiologist and ENT specialist.

title: Menopause and Your Ears: How Hormone Shifts Change Hearing (and What Helps)
description: Hormonal changes in perimenopause and menopause can nudge your hearing and tinnitus. Here’s what the science says, how to spot patterns, and practical steps—tech, lifestyle, and clinical care—that genuinely help.

title: Auracast Is Coming: How Bluetooth LE Audio Will Transform Hearing in Public Places
description: A clear, practical guide to Auracast and Bluetooth LE Audio: what it is, why it matters for hearing aids and cochlear implants, how it compares to hearing loops, what to buy (or hold off on), and simple steps to get ready.

title: Vaccines That Protect Your Hearing: The Shots Worth Getting
description: Yes—some vaccines lower your risk of hearing loss by preventing infections that damage the ear and auditory nerve. Here’s how, which shots matter most, and how to get up to date without the guesswork.

title: Sleep Apnea and Your Hearing: The Hidden Connection You Shouldn’t Ignore
description: Snoring or treating sleep apnea? Your ears could be affected, too. Here’s what research says about obstructive sleep apnea, hearing loss, and tinnitus—plus practical steps and when to see an audiologist.

title: After a Concussion, Why Your Ears Struggle: The Auditory Side of Mild TBI
description: Concussions can leave hearing and balance struggling—even when the audiogram looks normal. Here’s what research says about tinnitus, sound sensitivity, speech-in-noise problems, and how an audiologist can help you recover.

title: Clarity Over Loudness: Word Recognition, Speech-in-Noise, and Your Hearing Options
description: If you can hear sounds but struggle to understand words—especially in noise—you’re not alone. Learn what word recognition and speech-in-noise testing reveal, why clarity is different from loudness, and the practical tools and strategies that actually help.

title: That Clogged, Echoey Ear: Adult Eustachian Tube Dysfunction and Your Hearing
description: Why your ear feels full and sounds muffled, what’s really going on with your Eustachian tube, and practical, evidence‑based steps to protect your hearing—at home, in the clinic, and when you fly.

title: Ototoxic Medications: Protect Your Hearing Without Compromising Treatment
description: Some lifesaving medications can harm hearing. Here’s how to lower your risk—before, during, and after treatment—without skipping the care you need.

title: Your Heart, Your Hearing: The Cardiometabolic Link You Can’t Afford to Ignore
description: Emerging research shows your cardiovascular health and your hearing are deeply connected. Here’s what science says, why it matters, and how to protect both.

title: Single-Sided Deafness in Adults: CROS, Bone-Anchored, or Cochlear Implant?
description: A practical, evidence-based guide to treating single-sided deafness (SSD) in adults. Learn how CROS/BiCROS hearing aids, bone-anchored systems, and cochlear implants compare, who each option fits best, realistic outcomes, timelines, and how to work with your audiologist and ENT to choose confidently.

title: Your Ears, Your Brain: The Cognitive Upside of Treating Hearing Loss
description: A practical, evidence-based guide to how addressing hearing loss can support long-term brain health—plus simple steps to start today.

title: Your Daily Sound Diet: Noise Hygiene Habits That Protect Your Hearing (Without Becoming a Hermit)
description: A practical, fun guide to building ‘noise hygiene’ into everyday life—so you can enjoy concerts, workouts, and family time while keeping your ears healthy for decades.

title: Tinnitus Relief With Hearing Aids: What Actually Helps (And How to Set Yours Up Right)
description: A practical, evidence-informed guide to using hearing aids for tinnitus relief: how and why they help, features to look for, a 4-week plan to get comfortable, and when to see an audiologist.

title: Sudden Hearing Loss: The 72-Hour Treatment Playbook (What to Do Now)
description: A practical, time-sensitive guide to recognizing sudden hearing loss and getting the right treatment fast—what to expect at the clinic, which therapies help, and how to protect your hearing going forward.

title: Understanding Different Types of Hearing Loss
description: Learn about the various types of hearing loss, their causes, and available treatment options to make informed decisions about your hearing health.

title: When the Audiogram Says “Normal” But You’re Still Struggling: A Guide to Hidden Hearing Loss and Listening Fatigue
description: If conversations in noise feel exhausting even though your hearing test looks “normal,” you’re not imagining it. Learn what hidden hearing loss is, why it happens, the signs to watch, practical fixes that work today, and how an audiologist can help you hear—and feel—better.
